content: I don't have the ability to watch movies or tv shows, but generally speaking, the camera techniques used in bomb disposal scenes in "blast" or any other movie/tv show are likely to be fast-moving shots with cuts and close-ups. to create suspense and tension, there may be shaky handheld shots or rapid zooms to convey a sense of urgency and danger. the camera may also focus on certain details or objects to emphasize their importance in the disarmament process. additionally, lighting and sound effects may be used to heighten the intensity of the scene.
